books.title: The Great Gatsby
books.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
books.description: A classic American novel set in the Jazz Age, exploring themes of wealth, love, and the American Dream.

books.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
books.author: Harper Lee
books.description: A powerful story of racial injustice and childhood innocence in the American South.

books.author: George Orwell
books.description: A dystopian novel about totalitarianism and surveillance in a future society.

books.title: Pride and Prejudice
books.author: Jane Austen
books.description: A romantic novel exploring love, class, and social expectations in Regency England.

books.title: The Catcher in the Rye
books.author: J.D. Salinger
books.description: A coming-of-age story following teenage Holden Caulfield in New York City.

books.title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
books.author: J.K. Rowling
books.description: The first book in the magical Harry Potter series about a young wizard's adventures.

books.title: The Lord of the Rings
books.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
books.description: An epic fantasy trilogy about hobbits, wizards, and the quest to destroy the One Ring.

books.title: The Hunger Games
books.author: Suzanne Collins
books.description: A dystopian young adult novel about survival and rebellion in a post-apocalyptic world.

books.title: Brave New World
books.author: Aldous Huxley
books.description: A science fiction novel exploring themes of technology, society, and human nature.

books.title: The Da Vinci Code
books.author: Dan Brown
books.description: A mystery thriller involving art, history, and religious conspiracies.

books.title: Dune
books.author: Frank Herbert
books.description: A science fiction epic set on the desert planet Arrakis, featuring politics, religion, and ecology.

books.title: The Handmaid's Tale
books.author: Margaret Atwood
books.description: A dystopian novel about women's rights and reproductive freedom in a totalitarian society.
